page.title: 07Unemployment in Stowmarket
page.content: At a time of great national concern over the level of unemployment, Stowmarket offers more job opportunities than many other towns. In June 1985 8.9% of the population was unemployed compared with a national figure of 13.2%. Of those unemployed 545 were male and 352 female.The most commonly sought job among the men was van driving but demand from employers for this kind of work was low. Some at least of the unemployed were prepared to accept almost any kind of work. The unemployment figures were expected to show a seasonal rise as school leavers entered the job market but this upward move is modified by the fact that many 16 year olds either enter sixth forms, or go to Suffolk College or Youth Training Schemes. Older people have most difficulty in finding jobs.Main employers are I.C.I
